Detailed Description

This class displays an array as a grid of objects, where each object is represented by a view. The view is controlled by creating a CPCollectionViewItem and specifying its view, then setting that item as the collection view prototype.

Delegate Methods

-(void)collectionViewDidChangeSelection:(CPCollectionView)collectionView; Called when the selection in the collection view has changed.

Parameters:
collectionView the collection view who's selection changed

-(void)collectionView:(CPCollectionView)collectionView didDoubleClickOnItemAtIndex:(int)index; Called when the user double-clicks on an item in the collection view.

Parameters:
collectionView the collection view that received the double-click
index the index of the item that received the double-click

-(CPData)collectionView:(CPCollectionView)collectionView dataForItemsAtIndexes:(CPIndexSet)indices forType:(CPString)aType; Invoked to obtain data for a set of indices.

Parameters:
collectionView the collection view to obtain data for
indices the indices to return data for
aType the data type
Returns:
a data object containing the index items

-(CPArray)collectionView:(CPCollectionView)collectionView dragTypesForItemsAtIndexes:(CPIndexSet)indices; Invoked to obtain the data types supported by the specified indices for placement on the pasteboard.

Parameters:
collectionView the collection view the items reside in
indices the indices to obtain drag types
Returns:
an array of drag types (CPString)

- (void) setAllowsEmptySelection: (BOOL)  shouldAllowEmptySelection   [implementation]

Sets whether the user may have no items selected. If YES, mouse clicks not on any item will empty the current selection. The first item will also start off as selected.

Parameters:
shouldAllowMultipleSelection YES allows the user to select multiple items

- (void) setContent: (CPArray)  anArray   [implementation]

Sets the content of the collection view to the content in anArray. This array can be of any type, and each element will be passed to the -setRepresentedObject: method. It's the responsibility of your custom collection view item to interpret the object.

Parameters:
anArray the content array

00212 }

- (void) tile   [implementation]

Definition at line 365 of file CPCollectionView.j.

00366 {
00367     var width = CGRectGetWidth([self bounds]);
00368 
00369     if (![_content count] || width == _tileWidth)
00370         return;
00371 
00372     // We try to fit as many views per row as possible.  Any remaining space is then 
00373     // either proportioned out to the views (if their minSize != maxSize) or used as
00374     // margin
00375     var itemSize = CGSizeMakeCopy(_minItemSize);
00376 
00377     _numberOfColumns = MAX(1.0, FLOOR(width / itemSize.width));
00378 
00379     if (_maxNumberOfColumns > 0)
00380         _numberOfColumns = MIN(_maxNumberOfColumns, _numberOfColumns);
00381 
00382     var nbItems = [_items count];
00383     if (_numberOfColumns > nbItems)
00384         _numberOfColumns = nbItems;
00385 
00386     var maxItemSize = CGSizeMakeCopy(_maxItemSize);
00387     if (maxItemSize.width==0)
00388         maxItemSize.width = FLOOR(width / _numberOfColumns);
00389 
00390    var remaining = width - _numberOfColumns * itemSize.width,
00391         itemsNeedSizeUpdate = NO;
00392         
00393     if (remaining > 0 && itemSize.width < _maxItemSize.width)
00394         itemSize.width = MIN(_maxItemSize.width, itemSize.width + FLOOR(remaining / _numberOfColumns));
00395     
00396     // When we ONE column and a non-integral width, the FLOORing above can cause the item width to be smaller than the total width.
00397     if (_maxNumberOfColumns == 1 && itemSize.width < _maxItemSize.width && itemSize.width < width)
00398         itemSize.width = MIN(_maxItemSize.width, width);
00399     
00400     if (!CGSizeEqualToSize(_itemSize, itemSize))
00401     {
00402         _itemSize = itemSize;
00403         itemsNeedSizeUpdate = YES;
00404     }
00405     
00406     var index = 0,
00407         count = _items.length;
00408     
00409     if (_maxNumberOfColumns > 0 && _maxNumberOfRows > 0)
00410         count = MIN(count, _maxNumberOfColumns * _maxNumberOfRows);
00411     
00412     _numberOfRows = CEIL(count / _numberOfColumns);
00413 
00414     _horizontalMargin = FLOOR((width - _numberOfColumns * itemSize.width) / (_numberOfColumns + 1));
00415         
00416     var x = _horizontalMargin,
00417         y = -itemSize.height;
00418     
00419     for (; index < count; ++index)
00420     {
00421         if (index % _numberOfColumns == 0)
00422         {
00423             x = 0;
00424             y += _verticalMargin + itemSize.height;
00425         }
00426         
00427         var view = [_items[index] view];
00428         
00429         [view setFrameOrigin:CGPointMake(x, y)];
00430         [view setFrameSize:CGSizeMake([self frameSize].width, [view frameSize].height)];
00431 
00432                 if (itemsNeedSizeUpdate)
00433             [view setFrameSize:_itemSize];
00434             
00435         x += itemSize.width;
00436     }
00437     
00438     _tileWidth = width;
00439     [self setFrameSize:CGSizeMake(width, y + itemSize.height + _verticalMargin)];
00440     _tileWidth = -1.0;
00441 }
